qas.question: On what day was London itself attacked?
What group was the first to use incendiaries?
How many fire bombs were dropped per minute?
How many civilians were killed in the bombing?
The Luftwaffe dropped how many short tons of bombs?

context: Probably the most devastating strike occurred on <a0_0>the evening of 29 December<a0_0/>, when German aircraft attacked the City of London itself with incendiary and high explosive bombs, causing a firestorm that has been called the Second Great Fire of London. The first group to use these incendiaries was <a1_0>Kampfgruppe 100<a1_0/> which despatched 10 "pathfinder" He 111s. At 18:17, it released the first of 10,000 fire bombs, eventually amounting to <a2_0>300<a2_0/> dropped per minute. Altogether, 130 German bombers destroyed the historical centre of London. Civilian casualties on London throughout the Blitz amounted to <a3_0>28,556 killed<a3_0/>, and 25,578 wounded. The Luftwaffe had dropped <a4_0>18,291 short tons<a4_0/> (16,593 t) of bombs.
